Package ohos.miscservices.inputmethodability

Class KeyboardController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.miscservices.inputmethodability.KeyboardController

  • public final class KeyboardController
extends Object
    Enables your application to control the input method keyboard.

    You can use the methods provided in this class to switch between input methods, hide input method keyboards, set the keyboard layout, and obtain and set the keyboard display mode.

    Since:
    3

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int DISPLAY_MODE_FULL
      Indicates that the current keyboard is displayed in full-screen mode.
      static int DISPLAY_MODE_PART
      Indicates that the current keyboard is displayed in partial screen (normal mode).

    • Field Detail

      • DISPLAY_MODE_FULL

        public static final int DISPLAY_MODE_FULL
        Indicates that the current keyboard is displayed in full-screen mode.

        The full-screen mode means that the keyboard window occupies the entire screen. In this mode, the edit box on the client is blocked. Therefore, the input method application must be able to draw and display a keyboard and a custom edit box. The custom edit box can use the KeyboardDelegate callback interface to synchronize the cursor position and the text being entered in the edit box on the client.

        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DISPLAY_MODE_PART

        public static final int DISPLAY_MODE_PART
        Indicates that the current keyboard is displayed in partial screen (normal mode).

        In normal mode, the keyboard window occupies a part of the screen, and the remaining part of the screen is occupied by the window where the edit box of the client is located. The normal mode is commonly used by most input method applications.

        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • setDisplayMode

        public void setDisplayMode​(int mode)
        Sets or changes the keyboard display mode.

        Your application can use this method to notify the framework of the expected keyboard display mode. The setting takes effect next time the keyboard window is displayed.

        Parameters:
        mode - Indicates the keyboard display mode to set. DISPLAY_MODE_PART indicates partial screen (normal mode), and DISPLAY_MODE_FULL indicates the full-screen mode.
        Since:
        3

      • getDisplayMode

        public int getDisplayMode​()
        Obtains the real-time display mode of the keyboard.
        Returns:
        Returns DISPLAY_MODE_PART if the keyboard is displayed in partial screen (normal mode); returns DISPLAY_MODE_FULL if the keyboard is displayed in full-screen mode.
        Since:
        3

      • hideKeyboard

        public void hideKeyboard​()
        Hides the keyboard.
        Since:
        3

      • toNextInputMethod

        public boolean toNextInputMethod​()
        Switches to the next input method application.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • getScreenOrientation

        public int getScreenOrientation​()
        Obtains the real-time screen direction.
        Returns:
        Returns Configuration.DIRECTION_VERTICAL if the screen is displayed vertically; returns Configuration.DIRECTION_HORIZONTAL if the screen is displayed horizontally.
        Since:
        3

      • setKeyboardContainer

        public boolean setKeyboardContainer​(ComponentContainer container)
        Sets the keyboard component container.

        This method can be used to set or change the keyboard component container. You can set custom UI components in the container.

        Parameters:
        container - Indicates the container to set.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3
